results.title: Discus
results.brief_description:

results.title: The Rabies threat
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Antonio Colacino and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Shows the problems caused by the animal disease rabies, and outlines the work of the Animal Quarantine Service which functions to keep out of Australia all exotic animal diseases.

results.title: High Hopes
results.brief_description: Lyn and Patrice leave school with definite plans for their careers. Following long periods unemployed they reassess their aspirations and finally accept jobs they didn’t really want.

results.title: Simple looms. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Ken J. Widdowson and John Gray
results.brief_description: A how-to-do it program intended to provide the viewer with the confidence, skill and interest to try it for themselves. Suggestions are given on how inspiration and ideas may be drawn from the natural world for weaving design themes.

results.title: Is it always right to be right?
results.creator_credit: Lee Mishkin, Nick Bosustow and Stephen Bosustow Productions

video_links.name: Is it always right to be right?

results.brief_description: This fast moving parable, designed to provoke discussion without alienating any group, highlights the centres of divisiveness in our society, the generation gap, poverty, war and race. It tells of a land “where men were always right”. This animated film is a winner of many awards including an Academy Award. Narrated by Orson Welles.
results.title_for_label: Is it always right to be right?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lee Mishkin, Nick Bosustow and Stephen Bosustow Productions

results.title: How to keep a job
results.brief_description: Discusses the habits and attitudes that make for job success once the job is obtained. A man seeking a new job after being fired at his last job is interviewed by the Personnel director of a company and is told that employers want men who are dependable, willing to work, co-operate, loyal and possess initiative.
